etymologies: Middle English broklemok, from brook + hleomoce, the name of the plant in Old English

definitions: a speedwell with smooth, fleshy leaves and deep blue flowers on long stalks. It grows in wet areas, where the stems take root or float in the water.

notes.text: Genus Veronica, family Scrophulariaceae: several species, in particular V. beccabunga of Eurasia and the American brooklime (V. americana)

shortDefinitions: Eurasian speedwell with smooth fleshy leaves
